A short tutorial on Angular 6

Before starting to learn Angular, you will need to download nodeJS, make sure you everything installed.

Setting up your workspace

First open a cmd command line window, move to your working directory and create a new project with the following command: 

	ng new ng6 --style=css --routing

The style flag "--style = css" means we are planning to use css to style our page
The routing flag "--routing" means we want a project with different page urls.

After this command, a new folder named ng6 will be created in the current directory
Again, in the cmd command line window, use the following command to move into the folder that we just created: 

	cd ng6

Now we are in the ng6 folder,

In order to see the project, we need to enter the following in the cmd command line. This command will open a new window with your default web browser, when every changes are made, this page will update immediately. 

	ng serve -o

Generate a component

In the ng6 folder, run the following command to create a component called "example" 

	ng generate component example

The CLI creates a folder, src/app/example/, and generates four files of the example.component.

  • example.component.html
  • example.component.scss
  • example.component.spec.ts
  • example.component.ts
